document.text: Mrs. R. H. Bruce has received word that her husband has been wounded, on Hospital Ship Bryce Canyon. The Rev. and Mrs. C. G. Carter, of Charlottesville, visited in the home of Mr. and Mrs. J. K. Hamil ton the past week. M. M. Gearhart, of Bristol spent Tuesday night in the home of Mr. and Mrs. Elijah Farrar. Mrs. M. L. Hudson is improving nicely at the Virginia Baptist Hos pital after an operation the past week. Lewis Harvey, U. S. N., from Washington, spent the week-end here with his wife. Mr. and Mrs. R. H. Wooldridge and daughter, Barbara Ann, were j dinner guests Sunday in the home I of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Paulette. Mr. and Mrs. R. E. Harris and daughter, Joan and Doris Ausun, were visiting in Farmville Sunday evening. Pvt. H. C. Staples, Jr., of Foit Bragg, N. C., spent the week-end with his parents, Mr. and Mrs. H C. Staples. K. C. Paulette and Mrs. O. C. Paulette were dinner guests Sunday in the home of Mr. and Mrs. J. E. Paulette, of Madison Heights.

document.text: Gearhart is shot through both lungs and cannot live. Hubler is shot in the arm and will recover. No I one knows the cause of the tragedy or where Green procured the revolv- the fourth proposition for union ! er- He laid in wait for his victims and without a word fired on them.
